text: Hey, is there an easy way to sanitize a string to be filename-friendly?

elements.text: Hey, is there an easy way to sanitize a string to be filename-friendly?

text: I don't think so. It's also hard to pin down exactly what that means. Can it include `/` , for example? That's valid for a path, but not for a file name. Or `~` ? Sometimes, that's OK, other times, it will refer to the home directory. It's also platform-dependent

text: yeah, that makes sense, actually… what I want is essentially a kind of urlencode thingy, but since my needs were simple enough, I just sanitized by hand
